author: amy johns
text: videogames"clothing in videogames has been overlooked for too long," says wilbert das, head designer for diesel. in september, das' killer garb takes to the virtual catwalk in psygnosis' g-police - weapons of justice. it's the first clothing line designed by a fashion company for a videogame - das and his diesel compadres call the look "futuristic military." the design house also sells real versions of the fatigues in its stores and on the web (www.diesel.com). its army-green bombardier jacket ($400) and full-body metallic mesh suit ($300) are sure to bring out the inner commando in anyone. says das: "we're trying to infuse videogames with a bit of cool."must readsputterniktired/wiredgood dealas the well turnsall's well that ends wellsmarter bombbattlefield of tomorrowpass it onfashion policewhy buy retail?paranoia technologytailor-made medspeoplejargon watchpersonality typingcustomize or diesailing the red skiesgrubstake grillt1, good buddyraw data
